reviewText: Until recently I had never heard of Eddie Izzard. Blame it on no cable beyond basic for a few years. But after seeing him in Across the universe and The Riches my curiosity was piqued and I stated to check out his standup. I've ordered most of them and they are all worthwhile having. DTK & Glorious are the best but even his others are worth checking out. Timeless comedy!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Another hilarious DVD from Eddie.  While it may be lacking some of the social commentary and serious moments found on later DVDs, it is full of comedy which will have you laughing so hard your stomach will hurt and you'll have tears in your eyes.  Buy this; you won't be sorry.

reviewerName: Bex "Female chick from the eastern shore of M...
reviewText: I've seen all the Eddie videos (some way way too many times) and I have to say that this one is my favorite if just for the Corinthian skit alone.He's sharp, he's "on" and he's Eddie.  There's nothing more to ask for.My recommendation in order of best to less best:Definite ArticleDress to killGloriousSexie (saw him live both nights in DC and he was awesome)UnrepeatableCircle (not his best tour - I saw him live on that one)But crap Eddie is better immeasurably than no Eddie so pick any one and start there.

reviewText: Eddie Izzard is the king of improv and this DVD is no exception.This is probably his best show up to "Dress to Kill." I would not hesitate in recommending this DVD to anyone! I've loved Eddie since "Glorious."
Title: N/A

reviewText: Izzard is the greatest comedian in the world! His performances are always employing his vast array of expressions, movements, and pitch. He has perfect comedic timing and I am shocked that he is not more famous than he already is! He's certainly better than any American comic I can think of.He is so wonderfully talented and hilarious.The best way to spend time.I sometimes find myself going on Eddie withdrawal.EPIC!Eddie steals our hearts and laughter!Go buy it now! ^.^
summary: Once Again... We Worship The "Mad Skills" of a Brilliant Comedian!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Laugher is healthful and relieves stress, not to mention making you feel good.Eddie Izzard is witty, intelligent, and just downright funny. He is unlike any other person I have heard called a "Stand Up Comic". I would call him more of a social satirist. He touches on history, culture, philosphy, religion, politics,----nothing is off limits. You HAVE to hear him doing the voices of God and Jesus. Normally I am touchy about people using Christianity for jokes but this is not only not offensive it is HILARIOUS.I have everything available of his, on DVD. "Dressed to Kill" is the one that I have watched 12 times now. It is my "go to" DVD when the whole week has stunk and I need a litle escape.Of course the British accent lends itself to additional laughter in the way he uses it. If you have any trouble with British accents put the closed captioning on---it will greatly improve your enjoyment.I LOVE EDDIE-----makes me laugh just thinking of some of the things he says. GET HIS DVDs and treat yourself to a unique experience.

reviewText: Eddie Izzard is without a doubt my favorite comedian out there.  This one isn't quite as sharp as Dress To Kill but it is still fantastic.  This is a must for any fan of the Executive Transvestite.

reviewText: Not quite as good as Dressed to Kill or Glorious, but if you consider yourself an Izzard fan and Haven't seen this you have to get it. he touches on thimbles, horseraceing, late night shoping in petrol station, and his clarinet teacher. The ending bit in particular had me laughing for at least five minuets after the credits rolled. This is one of the mans best shows and it deserves the 5/5 I gave it.

reviewerName: kitjank "Guitar Goddess, artist, love of all ...
reviewText: Not as good as "Dressed to Kill", but it's damn close!  Izzard's ablity to take the everyday and make it absurd is classic.  I will never look at old ladies in the grocery store the same way.  If you liked his other shows, you will really enjoy this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I know some people loved this DVD.  Humor is mostly hit or miss, but for me, this had a lot more misses.  I actually fell asleep half way through this one the first time that I saw it.  I own a total of 4 Eddie Izzard comedy DVDs/Videos: Unrepeatable, Dress to kill, Glorious, and Definite Article.  All of the first three listed I would list as 4 to 5 stars.  This one just didn't strike me as very funny either in presentation or the jokes.  My advice:  If you own those other three and really loved those, get this DVD.  It seems most (but not all) Izzard fans liked this one, so it would be worth checking out.  If you don't own the other ones, check out one (or more) of those first.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'll admit, I've purchased, watched and loved five of his DVDs. In one week.This DVD is very good - but I prefer Dress to Kill, Circle, and Glorious. It seems to be one of his earlier routines, but not as early as Unrepeatable. He keeps you laughing, as usual. I can see why one reviewer said it appeals to British audiences, but I think this is simply his earlier material - we understood the material/humor just fine.If you're an Eddie fan and have Circle and Dress to Kill, then I'd recommend Glorious as your next purchase. If you're wondering if you should try an Eddie DVD, I'd recommend Dress to Kill or Circle. Once you're used to his style, any Eddie DVD is a good laugh.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an earlier show of Eddie's, and as usual, he is at the "top of his game".  This DVD will keep you laughing...and just sometimes just "scratching your head" in wonderment!  I can guarantee that for over and hour plus...you definitely won't be bored.  If nothing else, you will be amazed at how much better he is at walking in "heels", than most women!
summary: Eddie Izzard!  As REAL as a person can be!  Kudos to Eddie Izzard!

reviewText: I am a huge Eddie Izzard fan!  I have watched this DVD over and over and especially had fun with the commentary on, which he does himself.  It's like watching with him sitting along side me--FUN!  He's magical.  I can watch the same bit over and over, and it just gets funnier each time!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was encouraged to watch EI in "Dress to Kill" by a friend and while initially put off by the transvestite business found the show to be interesting and thoughtful -- and only fairly risqu? considering what I expected. So I ventured to watch another. This has not been a disappointment though I feel Dress to Kill was a bit more interesting and thoughtful. Still, the skits are great. EI does not tell jokes per se -- except perhaps in emergencies! Instead, he sets a mind set that is fairly ludicrous but cohesive and persistent leading to some stunningly funny consequences. So please do not be put off by the dressing issue. You will miss a great experience.
Title: N/A
